privacy.name: Privacy & Security
privacy.description: Flags that affect privacy, tracking, and security features

performance.name: Performance
performance.description: Flags that affect browser performance and resource usage

ui.name: User Interface
ui.description: Flags that change the browser UI

media.name: Media & Graphics
media.description: Audio, video, and graphics rendering flags

flags.description: Enable fingerprinting resistance to make browser tracking harder

negative: May break websites relying on accurate timezone
interesting: Part of Tor Browser's privacy model

flags.description: Enable Enhanced Tracking Protection

negative: Can interfere with social media widgets

flags.description: Send Do Not Track header with all requests

negative: Can make you more fingerprintable (fewer users enable it)
interesting: Being phased out in favor of GPC

flags.description: Isolate cookies and storage by first-party domain (like Tor Browser)

negative: Logout from one site doesn't affect others
CDN resources may load multiple times

flags.description: Clear cache when Firefox closes

interesting: Can combine with other clearOnShutdown flags

flags.description: Draw tabs in the title bar area

negative: May conflict with window manager themes

flags.description: Minimum width of tabs in pixels

positive: More tabs visible with lower value
negative: Too small makes tabs hard to click

flags.description: Show sponsored suggestions in address bar
Enable HTTP/3 protocol support (QUIC transport)

positive: Faster page loads on supported servers
negative: May have compatibility issues with some CDNs

flags.description: Disable DNS prefetching for links on pages
Enable network predictor (learns and preloads resources)

positive: Faster page loads on frequently visited sites

flags.description: Control when Referer header is sent cross-origin (0=always, 1=same-base-domain, 2=same-host)
Enable CSS Grid Layout support
Enable CSS backdrop-filter property (blur/effects behind elements)
Enable browser chrome debugging (inspect Firefox's own UI)
Enable remote debugging protocol
Force WebRender on all windows (GPU-accelerated rendering)

negative: May cause graphical glitches on some GPUs

flags.description: Enable GPU acceleration for Canvas 2D API
Force all connections to use HTTPS

negative: May prevent access to local development servers

flags.description: Enable Web Notifications API

positive: Better user engagement for web apps

flags.description: Enable disk cache for web content

interesting: Can be combined with memory-only cache

flags.description: Enable memory cache for web content
Control what data is saved in session restore (0=all, 1=no-https, 2=never)
Enable WebRTC peer connections

negative: Can leak real IP address even with VPN
interesting: Major privacy concern for VPN users
IP leak prevention requires additional config

flags.description: Control media autoplay (0=allow, 1=block audio, 2=block all, 5=block all with exceptions)

negative: May break legitimate autoplay (games, music sites)
Some sites require manual play button click
interesting: Affects only audible media by default

flags.description: Enable Web Speech Synthesis API (text-to-speech)

negative: Can be annoying if websites abuse it

flags.description: Force disable accessibility features (0=normal, 1=disabled)

negative: Makes browser unusable for disabled users
interesting: Should never be enabled unless you know what you're doing
Can cause crashes with assistive tech

flags.description: Download files directly to download folder without asking

interesting: Can combine with download folder setting

flags.description: Enable malware protection via Safe Browsing
Enable phishing protection via Safe Browsing
Enable Geolocation API
Enable DOM Storage (localStorage/sessionStorage)

positive: Web apps can store data locally

flags.description: Enable IndexedDB API

negative: Disabling breaks many modern web apps
interesting: No size limit (user approval needed for large sizes)

flags.description: Show top sites on new tab page

negative: Data sent to Mozilla for personalization

flags.description: Show recent highlights on new tab page
Enable Pocket integration
Enable Firefox telemetry data collection

negative: Privacy concern (usage data sent to Mozilla)

flags.description: Upload Firefox Health Report data
Disable IPv6 DNS lookups

positive: Slightly faster DNS on IPv4-only networks
interesting: May reduce DNS privacy (fewer A/AAAA queries)

flags.description: DNS-over-HTTPS mode (0=off, 2=TRR first, 3=TRR only, 5=off by choice)

negative: May break local network name resolution
interesting: Mode 3 is most private but may break captive portals

flags.description: Perform DNS lookups through SOCKS proxy

positive: Prevents DNS leaks when using SOCKS proxy

flags.description: Enable Service Workers API (PWA support)
Enable Push API for web notifications

interesting: Uses Mozilla's push service by default

flags.description: Enable WebAssembly support

interesting: Used by major web apps (Figma, AutoCAD)

flags.description: Enable WebAssembly SIMD (vector operations)

negative: Not all CPUs support SIMD efficiently
interesting: Major performance boost for media apps

flags.description: Enable WebAssembly garbage collection proposal

interesting: Allows Java/Kotlin/C# to compile to WASM efficiently

flags.description: Enable WebGPU API (next-gen graphics)
Allow websites to use custom fonts (0=never, 1=allow)

positive: Faster page loads without web fonts

flags.description: Remember zoom level per-site

positive: Convenient for sites needing different zoom
negative: Can be confusing if you forget

flags.description: Close browser window when last tab is closed
Open bookmarks in new tabs instead of current tab

interesting: Middle-click always opens in new tab

flags.description: Show warning when closing multiple tabs
Enable Battery Status API
Allow websites to detect clipboard events (copy/paste)

positive: Better copy/paste UX on some sites
negative: Websites know when you copy text

flags.description: Enable Gamepad API for controller support
Enable WebVR API (deprecated, use WebXR)

interesting: Worked with Oculus Rift, HTC Vive

flags.description: Enable WebXR API (VR/AR headset support)
Enable Encrypted Media Extensions (DRM for video)
Enable hardware video decoding via VAAPI (Linux)

positive: Much lower CPU usage for video
negative: May have glitches on some hardware

flags.description: Enable Picture-in-Picture mode for videos
Enable VP8/VP9 encoding for MediaRecorder
Content blocking level (standard/strict/custom)
Partition network state by top-level site (Total Cookie Protection)
Send Global Privacy Control (GPC) signal

positive: Legally binding opt-out in some jurisdictions

flags.description: How to open links (1=current, 2=new window, 3=new tab)
Restrict popups (0=always allow, 2=block)
Show search suggestions in address bar
Enable smart keywords in address bar

negative: Can be confusing for new users

flags.description: Hide 'http://' and trailing slashes in address bar
Alt key shows menu bar (Windows/Linux)

negative: May interfere with web app shortcuts

flags.description: Require TLS with safe renegotiation
Minimum TLS version (1=TLS 1.0, 2=TLS 1.1, 3=TLS 1.2, 4=TLS 1.3)
Show 'Not Secure' text for HTTP sites

negative: Can be alarming for harmless HTTP sites

flags.description: Use new downloads panel UI
Enable Firefox View (recent tabs, synced tabs)
Width of debugger source pane in pixels
Show CSS warnings in web console

negative: Many false positives from third-party CSS
interesting: Off by default for good reason

flags.description: Features to record in Performance profiler

interesting: Options: js, stackwalk, screenshots, memory, cpu

flags.description: Respect viewport meta tags in Responsive Design Mode

negative: Sites without meta viewport behave oddly

flags.description: Show browser default styles in Inspector
Enable WebDriver (Selenium/automation)
Show password breach alerts in Lockwise

positive: Powered by Have I Been Pwned

flags.description: Offer to save passwords

negative: External password managers preferred by some

flags.description: Autofill login forms with saved passwords

interesting: Can be disabled separately from saving

flags.description: Offer to generate strong passwords

negative: Must use Firefox to access passwords

flags.description: Remember form history (non-password fields)

interesting: Can be cleared in privacy settings

flags.description: Days to keep browsing history

interesting: Can be very short for privacy

flags.description: Enable browsing history
Allow JavaScript to close browser windows

positive: Web apps can close their own windows
interesting: Restricted by default for good reason
Only works on script-opened windows in most cases

flags.description: Force media cache to RAM in private browsing

positive: No media cached to disk in private mode
negative: May cause issues with large videos

flags.description: Always start in private browsing mode

negative: Must login to sites every time

flags.description: Default camera permission (0=ask, 1=allow, 2=block)

negative: Must be set per-site if blocked

flags.description: Default microphone permission (0=ask, 1=allow, 2=block)
Default notification permission (0=ask, 1=allow, 2=block)
Default geolocation permission (0=ask, 1=allow, 2=block)
Delete temporary files when Firefox closes

negative: Can't access temp files after closing

flags.description: Disable capturing page thumbnails for new tab page

negative: New tab page shows no previews

flags.description: Disable camera/microphone permission prompts

negative: Sites can access camera/mic without asking

flags.description: Duration of fullscreen warning in milliseconds

negative: Can be annoying for legitimate fullscreen

flags.description: Enable smooth scrolling animations
Reduce animations (0=no preference, 1=reduce)
